page.title: 03Smuggling on the Marshes.
page.content: The{Pevensey Levels}and the surrounding areas have long been famous for{smuggling.}We discovered that the eighteenth century is often thought of as the golden age of Sussex {smuggling.}It would appear that nearly everyone was involved in one way or another and it is not difficult to imagine the smugglers bringing the goods stealthily across the{marshes. Our school is in{Hankham}and we know of houses in the area where smugglers were "welcome" in the olden days and where there are disused smuggler tunnels. The house opposite our school is called{The Dog House.}It received its name because the original cottages were occupied by the customs men and they were known as{Watchdogs.}Their job was to hunt down smugglers on the {marshes.}The house is owned by Mr.Gow, Member of Parliament for{Eastbourne.
